Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Kaleb-Wolf De Melo Torres, the spokesperson for Shriners Hospitals, did not die in late February 2021 as confirmed by the hospital.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on misinformation and confusion between two individuals with similar names and health conditions.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that another child, Kaleb Holder, who suffered from a terminal brain disease, died in late February 2021, leading to the confusion and false claim about Kaleb-Wolf De Melo Torres.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Kaleb-Wolf De Melo Torres, being a patient with osteogenesis imperfecta, died in late February 2021 without verifying the information.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by falsely stating that Kaleb-Wolf De Melo Torres died, when in fact, he is alive and doing well according to the hospital.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in this case.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not properly verifying the information before making the false statement about Kaleb-Wolf De Melo Torres' death.
